basics.label: Electrical Engineering Student
basics.summary: A third-year Electrical Engineering Student at McMaster University, currently gaining experience as as an Electrical Engineering Intern at Jitterrware.

work.name: Jitterrware
highlight: Designed and developed electrical systems, circuits, and PCB layouts using KiCAD and stm32CUBE.
Built and tested prototypes, troubleshot systems, and optimized designs for improved performance and efficiency.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to meet project deadlines, document progress, and provide technical reports.

work.name: Mathnasium
highlight: Led and motivated a team of 6 instructors, improving student retention by 25%
Increased enrollment by 40% through effective lead response and successful student onboarding.
Built strong relationships with students and parents by delivering exceptional customer service and progress updates.

highlights: Assisted lead instructor and created an inclusive learning environment.
Helped with Python and Scrath coding exercices and projects.
Helped students troubleshoot and overcome challenges in their projects.

projects.name: ControlCore
highlights: Designed a system monitoring and media controller using an ESP32 microcontroller and an OLED display.
Used C/C++ to integrate an ESP32 microcontroller with the display leveraging I2C/UART communication protocols.
Implemented a custom graphical user interface (GUI) with dynamic button layouts and easy navigation for seamless user interaction.

projects.name: Digital-to-Analog Converter
highlights: Designed a 3-bit DAC using a transistor-resistor network to convert digital inputs into proportional analog voltages.
Determined bit weights based on full-scale voltage ratio and the number of possible digital values.
Implemented a resistive network with an inverting unity-gain buffer to produce precise analog output from digital inputs.
